text.section: A person shall be licensed by the Department to conduct, operate, or maintain an assisted living program in the State.

section.section: A person shall submit an application for licensure to conduct, operate, or maintain an assisted living program to the Secretary on a form developed by the Secretary.
The Secretary shall develop the application for licensure required under paragraph (1) of this subsection.
The application shall include the name and address of each officer, manager, alternate manager, and delegating nurse or case manager of the assisted living program.
An applicant for licensure shall submit the fee established in regulation under § 19-1805(b)(2)(ii) of this subtitle.

The Secretary shall:
Review the application and information received under subsection (b) of this section; and
Conduct an independent investigation of the assisted living program applying for initial licensure.

Based on the review and investigation conducted under paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Secretary shall:
Authorize the unconditional approval of the application;
Authorize the conditional approval of the application; or
Deny the application.
Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, an assisted living program license is valid for 2 years.
The Secretary may issue an initial probationary license that is valid for less than 2 years.
